title: Selena Gomez Calls Out “Women Tearing Women Down” After Hailey Bieber’s “I’ll Kill You” Post
text:
Whether Hailey Bieber’s little “I’ll Kill You” jab was aimed at Selena Gomez or not, Sel has hit back with a message to her ex’s new bride and all the other haters, particularly her fellow ladies.

In case you missed it, just minutes after Selena released her song ‘Lose You To Love Me’, which is rumoured to be about her ex Justin Bieber, Hailey posted a screenshot of Summer Walker and Jhené Aiko’s song “I’ll Kill You” on her Instagram Story.

Fans were adamant that the post was directed at Gomez as a form of retaliation on behalf of her hubby.

selena gomez releases her song about justin bieber marrying hailey baldwin at midnight and hailey has this on her story by 12:15 pic.twitter.com/BhjxoIdqPa — double name (@flannypack_) October 23, 2019

After Hailey’s social media became flooded with angry comments from followers, she clarified that her post was not aimed at her husband’s ex.

“Please stop with this nonsense… there is no ‘response,’” the model commented on an Instagram post about the rumours.

“This is complete BS.”

Now, Selena has called out women who tear other women down in a very pointed Instagram Live.

“I am grateful for the response that the song is getting. I’m so grateful,” Gomez said. “However, I do not stand for women tearing women down. And I will never, ever be by that. So please be kind to everyone. It doesn’t matter what the situation is. If you’re my fans, don’t be rude to anybody, please.”

She continued, “Don’t go off and say things that you just feel in the moment. Just please, for me, know that that’s not my heart. My heart is only to release things that I feel are me, and that I’m proud of. And that’s all I’ll say.”
description: After Hailey Bieber posted Insta Story saying "I'll Kill You", her response to Selena Gomez's song about Justin Bieber, Sel reacted via Instagram Live.
